Certainly, here are some additional tips for accessible travel in Budapest:

1. Visit museums and attractions: Most tourist attractions in Budapest are generally accessible, and many offer special services and facilities for visitors with disabilities. For example, the Hungarian National Museum and the Hungarian State Opera House provide wheelchair access and assistance for blind and visually impaired visitors. 2. Use accessible restrooms: Many hotels, restaurants, and shopping centers in Budapest provide accessible toilets for visitors with disabilities. You can also download an app called "Toilet Finder" to locate accessible restrooms nearby. 3. Shop for accessibility equipment: Budapest has several retailers that specialize in accessibility equipment, such as power wheelchairs, mobility scooters, and walkers. Some stores also offer rental services for mobility equipment. 4. Use accessibility apps: There are some mobile apps that can be useful for visitors with disabilities in Budapest. For example, Wheelmate provides information about accessible places such as restrooms, parking lots, and cafes. 5. Attend accessible events: Budapest hosts several accessible events throughout the year, such as the Budapest Wine Festival and the Budapest International Documentary Festival, which are accessible to visitors with disabilities. 6. Know your rights: Hungary has laws that protect the rights of people with disabilities, and you should feel comfortable asserting these rights if the need arises. Be aware of your rights, such as the requirement for accessible transportation and accommodation, and advocate for yourself if necessary. I hope these additional tips are helpful in planning an accessible and safe trip to Budapest!
